title: Step-by-Step Video-to-Audio Synthesis via Negative Audio Guidance
author: Akio Hayakawa (Sony AI), Masato Ishii (Sony AI), Takashi Shibuya (Sony AI), Yuki Mitsufuji (Sony AI, Sony Group Corporation), ...
relevance_why: The paper introduces a guided audio generation method that can enhance audio synthesis in multimedia applications, aligning well with efforts in generative audio research.
background: Generating audio that accurately corresponds to visual events in videos, similar to the Foley art in film production, while addressing creative and practical challenges.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel guided audio synthesis method utilizing Negative Audio Guidance (NAG) to iteratively create distinct audio tracks corresponding to sound events in a video.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods typically generate entire audio tracks simultaneously without modular control or specialized training datasets.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves the generative process by enabling step-by-step sound event generation, enhancing control and adaptability through the application of audio conditioning techniques.

key_innovation: Develops a framework for step-by-step audio synthesis using negative guidance to prevent the re-generation of already created audio events.
real_world_impact: Enhances the efficiency of audio production in multimedia content creation, making it easier for creators to generate high-quality audio that syncs with visuals.

new_terms.Foley: **Foley** refers to the reproduction of everyday sound effects that are added to films, videos, and other media in post-production to enhance audio quality.
new_terms.Negative Audio Guidance (NAG): **Negative Audio Guidance** is a novel technique introduced to guide audio generation by specifying sounds that should not appear based on previously generated tracks.
